phrase.item: 1. F.: What is your name?
ED: My name is E.D.
F.: Which village are you from?
ED ‘I’m from right here in this place, I was born right here in this place, I was dropped right here in this place’ (dropped = married?)
‘Here they have married me.’
‘Like a brother’s house, I married into a brother’s house, from our midst.’ (Her husband is from the same family. he’s her cousin)
2. F.: ‘What was that time like?’
ED: ‘So it was, if you ask me about earlier, if you (hear) the story like,’ ‘I'll tell you the true truth about the situation in the past,’ ‘as I remember what it was, and what may come (in memory),’
3. ‘It was just like this: there was a time of poverty.’
‘That is, there is no outside (extra) income.’
There was nothing.
‘As much as they were exerting themselves in the fields, ‘they were struggling. ‘‘That was their income

‘Now whatever they were taking from the earth, they were eating it.’ ‘and then they went there again, that they ate, Then they went back again, something became ripe, and then they took of it of the fields.
Otherwise there was no income
4. F: There were no shops?
ED: No, there were no shops
‘Our fathers were carrying loads on foot from Gilgit.’
Staying overnight, staying overnight, yes, walking!
F.: How many days on foot?
ED: They were carrying the mail, right? our fathers, our uncles were the mailmen
they were mailmen, then they were carrying the mail
‘then to Tashkurghan they were taking it on foot.’
They became wood, no, there was nothing, there was nothing.’
Car, we didn't know anything about cars. When the China road opened, and then cars happened.
5. ‘Previously there were no clothes, likewise the soup was not right, not anything.’ ‘Nor was there proper cleanliness, and their shoes, they have made themselves out of leather.’
This was good for the people, well for the efficient/hard-working people it was good.
‘the poor, they didn’t have anything, they borrowed from each other, they took, they ate the bread.’
In earlier times there was no tea, it was soup

In tea's place, there was soup if guests came their horses were (existing?), and then there were in front of the doors of our fathers five, six horses tied in a circle, they were sitting in the house They were making soup and then there was meat, there was butter.
6. F: What was this soup made of?
ED: Soup of dried apricots I thought, there was a wooden bowl, right?
They called it destak
Then they made soup in the wooden bowl.
Then five or six people sat in a circle, then they put a spoon in the middle, and in a circle, they were circling the spoon one at a time.
Such wooden spoon that had been so placed in the water channel, ‘Then they drank that (soup) at one place, at one place, on one dish.’
‘Yes, at one place they drank that (soup).’
7. ‘And what was happening during the sleep time:’ ‘There was no such real bed, right?’
‘Whoever was rich, he had new carpets.’
‘First they put blankets and on top of that they put carpets.’
‘There were only carpets, otherwise there was nothing?’
It was woolen carpets, right?
‘And then, fancy things like this were not there, the road was not there, right, before,’ ‘There was no income like this, there was no road, there were no cars, there were no real things like this.’
‘They used the carpet as a blanket, and then if they were visiting a place,’ they were celebrating in the house from sitting good and warm: Hey, they put new carpet, they said!
‘It was bedtime, there were no cars or road, and we didn’t even know about cars.’
When the China-road opened, we finally saw cars: a car, a car was driving by.
. F. ‘Do you remember that time?’ (Is it remembered to you)
I’m, I’m even on foot for five years on the horse pulled up by Kəlik, with my father (with) them!
Five years.
For five years we are on foot, my mother here, she still lives here, is not it?
They themselves went by foot from right here and right here, clumsily, up to Kelik with us, up through the ford, the ford was there, they crossed on horseback.
Through the path, through Khunjerab!

And just like this they were going: now from here to Ghalapan they not even going on foot, we not from here to Gircha; they say/complain there is no car they keep waiting for the car; like this we are staying.
The past was not like this time.
The food was also like this: If they had no seed to crop in the field, they were borrowing in from another brother, and they kept doing it!
They were borrowing the seed, growing it, when it was done, the other guy was waiting for them to give it back. And from outside there was no income.
They ate the spinach, from the field we were bringing spinach like this, we ate the spinach.
ED: The spinach grown in the field, no?
The little wild plants from the field; the spinach.
Just this they were eating.
There is no income like this, where you go to a place (to buy food), and I eat.
Whoever was active, he was walking all the way to Gulmit to bring vegetables, from Raminj, bringing things and eating.
To each other they were giving; then was a time of good hospitality.
You were not eating potato at that time here?
Whatever potato we have now, we didn't have before.
The cohesion then was very good, just like the income at the time was not good, the cohesion was very good.
The brothers treated each other very well.
Now they say, one says that I'm working, I am the best. The other says, I'm the best!
Now is a prideful time.
Yes.
At that time there were not so many clothes, there was not much to eat, so they were very fond of each other.
They were very fond of each other.
That has now been otherwise?
It is now different.
Now they no longer respect one another, one says I'm the best, the other says, I'm the best.
One say, my food is best, the other says, my appearance is best, my food is best, the other says my appearance is best, my food is best, they say.
Before there were boots, made of wood, wood I say, um, of leather!
Whoever had money, they made beautiful with leather, whoever did not have that walked barefoot.
The children they did not know to wash their face, up in there on their butt there were no pants.
For our kids, there was nothing known as pants.
Now you sew clothes, we wear, and then there was woolen cloth, woolen cloth: like this here [shows a ball of wool]
There was just this cloth: barefoot!
it was barefoot.
Just like this it was not a time of cleanliness, that yes to wake up and wash their hands and face or do this or that, they did nothing!
Like this much there was not, fancy.
Due to the kindness of the spiritual leader, the road opened, a good time now came to us.
Now everything (buy) with income, now no one is poor, through the kindness of the Imam.
There is no hardship.
But you don't like that people aren't fond of each other, that they don't respect each other.
No.
Not now.
There is not that.
The respect for each other decreased.
Now whatever the spiritual leader's speech to us is, saying that exactly that is also we don't know much about, and the respect for each other has decreased a lot.
Now that the road has come from China, from then really good things happened to us.
Women cannot just go to Hunza, right?
The men, they go, we are coming, right? The women are here in this place, yes.
We are here in this place, we are not going anywhere.
Yes, only to the pasture in Khunjerab will they go, they can.
To the Khunjerab, the pasture with our goats and sheep, with our yaks, with whom we walk up to the Khunjerab mountain pasture, along with our cattle.
